my my general philosophical as it were
temperament is to find a middle ground
between between extremes this is
something that that Aristotle also
recommended uh and um I think there are
two natural thoughts about identity
which are both wrong one natural thought
which which has been taken out by much
identity politics this is really great
stuff it's important it's wonderful we
should um you know no no human life can
be made sense of without lots and lots
of identity stuff uh and the other end
is the view that no what really matters
that you're a human being and all these
other things merely divide us from one
another and we should focus on our
common Humanity um and that what it is
to lead a good life is to lead a good
human life not a good American life not
a good gay life not a good straight life
whatever not a good Christian life but a
good human life and so on um I think
these are both wrong um that is to say I
think that you um it is important that
um identities can be a source of
limitation and constraint and that
therefore we shouldn't celebrate them
unreservedly uh but I think it's also
important to recognize that they can be
a source of Liberation and freedom and
meaning that they can help us make sense
of Our Lives um and so neither The View
According to which all
identity is sort of ethically and
politically to be escaped from nor the
view that we should settle into our
given identities and just sort of live
through them uh seems to me quite right
now that's a very abstract way of
characterizing a contribution but I
think that um it pays off when you start
thinking about some of the things that
I've written about like um um you know
how how religion should fit into
politics or uh questions about racial
identity and belonging and and the
balance between uh accepting that racial
identities are important for historical
reasons in our Society on the one hand
and on the other hand recognizing that
they can be sources of limitation and
constraint and that they therefore need
to be modified developed changed in ways
that allow people to do good things with

them again on the race question in
particular people are rather inclined to
suppose either that one should sort of
settle into one's racial Identity or
that in the end we should abandon racial
identities that we should move Beyond
race because our after all race is a is
a social construct and biological
fantasy and so
on I think from the fact that it's a
social construct or a biological fantasy
just doesn't follow that we have to
abandon it of course we have to abandon
those features of it that are committed
to these untruths uh but something
remains after that something
historically remains and whether people
should give up racial identities depends
on uh on the on the moral question that
is can you find racial identities that
allow you to be a decent person in your
treatment of of other people to which I
think the answer is yes uh and also it
depends
on um whether people want to go on with
it if people want to abandon their
racial identities hey I don't care I
mean that's fine by me it's up to them
that's the liberal thought the liberal
thought is people have to make their own
lives they have to decide which aspects
of their identities to to draw on if
they don't want to draw on a racial
identity it's not anybody else's job to
force them into doing so um but but if
people want to and if they can do in a
way that's morally responsible then I
see nothing wrong with it and again it
tends to be that there that the world is
divided between people who have one of
these extreme views we must move Beyond
racial Identity or we must stick you
know into the racial identities that we
have I think people um should I I don't
think we have to move Beyond them and I
think people should be free to make
their own sense of their racial
identities to develop them in the sort
of way in which over the last generation
we've been reshaping the social meaning
of gender we've been reshaping the
social meaning of race and I those are
fine things to be doing um and again
just as it would make no sense to me to
say we should abandon gender identities
on the grounds that sexism has has led
to some very bad things so I don't think
it's obvious that we should abandon
racial identities because racism has led
to some Very Bad Things
